## Return Value

Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/first()] to publish just the first element from an upstream publisher, then finish normally. The [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/first()] operator requests [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscribers/Demand/unlimited] from its upstream as soon as downstream requests at least one element. In this example, the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/first()] publisher republishes the first element received from the sequence publisher, `-10`, then finishes normally.

# first()

**Instance Method**

Publishes the first element of a stream, then finishes.

## Declaration

```swift
func first() -> Publishers.First<Self>
```

## Return Value

A publisher that only publishes the first element of a stream.

## Discussion

Use [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/first()] to publish just the first element from an upstream publisher, then finish normally. The [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/first()] operator requests [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Subscribers/Demand/unlimited] from its upstream as soon as downstream requests at least one element. If the upstream completes before [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/first()] receives any elements, it completes without emitting any values.

In this example, the [doc://com.apple.Combine/documentation/Combine/Publisher/first()] publisher republishes the first element received from the sequence publisher, `-10`, then finishes normally.

```swift
let numbers = (-10...10)
cancellable = numbers.publisher
    .first()
    .sink { print("\($0)") }

// Print: "-10"
```

## Selecting specific elements

- **first(where:)**: Publishes the first element of a stream to satisfy a predicate closure, then finishes normally.
- **tryFirst(where:)**: Publishes the first element of a stream to satisfy a throwing predicate closure, then finishes normally.
- **last()**: Publishes the last element of a stream, after the stream finishes.
- **last(where:)**: Publishes the last element of a stream that satisfies a predicate closure, after upstream finishes.
- **tryLast(where:)**: Publishes the last element of a stream that satisfies an error-throwing predicate closure, after the stream finishes.
- **output(at:)**: Publishes a specific element, indicated by its index in the sequence of published elements.
- **output(in:)**: Publishes elements specified by their range in the sequence of published elements.
